UI/UX Rule: Target: Seniors 65+. Design with large text, high clarity, avoid jargon.

Proposed: Comfortable with basics, struggle with complex UIs
UI/UX Rule: Keep UI simple, avoid complex navigation or hidden menus.

Proposed: Mostly desktop + tablets, rising mobile usage
UI/UX Rule: Prioritize desktop/tablet layouts, ensure mobile buttons are large/tap-friendly.

Proposed: Visible flat navigation, avoid dropdown-heavy menus
UI/UX Rule: Flat navigation bar, max 5–6 main menu items, minimal dropdowns.
Break content into FAQs, step-by-step guides, comparison tables.

Proposed: Prefer calling over filling long forms
UI/UX Rule: Make phone number primary CTA, form secondary. Short form only (name, phone, zip).

Proposed: Readable sans-serif (Arial, Roboto) at larger size
UI/UX Rule: Readable sans-serif fonts (Arial/Roboto) at least 16–18px, spacious line height.
Use blue/green/white scheme for trust, cleanliness, health associations.
High contrast text: dark on light, no gray-on-gray.

Proposed: Accent with warm colors (orange, yellow) for CTA buttons
UI/UX Rule: Orange/yellow buttons for CTAs to stand out clearly.
Above-the-fold headline + CTA. Keep nav clear.
Highlight mission, credibility, and trust badges/logos.
SEO blog layout with clear headlines, subheadings, CTA inserts.
Educational hub with FAQs in accordion style for easy scanning.

Proposed: Simple quiz / plan comparison with CTA
UI/UX Rule: Use comparison charts/tables with simple visuals (checkmarks).
Short form + large 'Call Now' button. CTAs repeated down page.
Always display disclaimers: CMS disclaimer + HIPAA/privacy footer.
